item.description:
Daecheon Beach where you can enjoy swimming in an underwater wheelchair

2016 selected tourist destination “Boryeong Daecheon Beach”

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

Daecheon Beach is the largest beach on the west coast (3.5km long white sand beach, 100m wide) where you can enjoy a beautiful sunset with gentle slopes and clean sand that has been a recreational complex for foreigners since the 1930s. In particular, this beach is famous as a summer tourist destination attracting the attention of the world and attracting attention from the world and abroad as a mud festival held every year aimed at summer.
[Contents of improving accessibility for vulnerable groups in Boryeong Daecheon Beach]

-Improving the doors of the disabled toilet and renovating the internal facilities
Installation of automatic doors for disabled toilets
The laughter of people who covered their bodies with mud never stops. This is the story of the Mud Festival held in the Boryeong Daecheon Beach. There are many things to enjoy besides mud massage. From sky bikes, sea baths to soothe the heat of the day, to mud baths and bubble baths. I don't think there is such a place to enjoy the hot summer. Above all, all of these are open to anyone. It is a record of travel with members of the Chungnam Severity Independent Living Association.
Aka 'open carpet'
Sea open to all
The area around Daecheon Beach became more beautiful. It is the realization of the value of enjoying the beach and the sea together without discrimination. Named 'Open Sea'.
Sea access using an underwater wheelchair
Twenty 10-meter carpets were laid on the sandy beach, and the US patented 'water chair' was prepared. Instead of a sandy beach that falls completely, even people with physical disabilities who cannot move themselves by riding a water chair rolling a carpet can enter the beach.
Sea bathing experience with safety personnel
Experience underwater swimming with the help of safety personnel on an underwater wheelchair
In addition, the scenery where three sturdy staff members hold water chairs and help people with disabilities to bathe is impressive. The sea, which was felt far and wide by people with physical disabilities, was wide open. The faces of people with disabilities who have experienced things they couldn't even do are full of laughter.
Prepare a safe space for people with disabilities to experience mud
The impression of the moment when the cool sea water touches the body is revealed with a facial expression, and the expressions of people looking at the scenery also shine brightly as if they realized the 'value of the same'. The sea was opened for the handicapped, and it is the moment when the mind is opened to the handicapped.
Mud Festival

Mud experience slide that can be enjoyed with the help of safety personnel


The impression is doubled in the kids zone, a little away from the main venue. Although the name is Kids Zone, it is an open experience area that can be used by the elderly and the disabled. The kids zone, which has been prepared for safety since this year, can be reached in a minute by tram car from the second watchtower. There are a variety of things to do, such as bubble experience, mud experience, and water slide. Even though there are no BF facilities such as ramps or braille blocks, the reason why you can enjoy this place is because of the help of the staff.

There are a variety of things to do, such as bubble experience, mud experience, and water slide. Even though there are no BF facilities such as ramps or braille blocks, the reason why you can enjoy this place is because of the help of the staff.
Festival venue
From mud and foam bottoms, from helping to prevent slippers from slipping through, jumping over huge thigh-high tubes and climbing downhill water slides, they all help. It's not just helping, but helping with all your heart. Soap bubbles and mud wash the eyes of those who have entered the eyes, hand over water to quench their thirst, and drag an experienced person who wants to slide in front, slide from the back, and climb an inclined tube. With the help, the face of the experienced person who enjoys the obstacles of the body freely is as bright as a child. I think I may have seen such an excited face recently. Every moment, the faces of the staff who help you are full of joy. It is full of sincerity and sincerity as if caring for each family.
Bubble Experience Center (Providing human service always with safety personnel)
Facilities are important, but opening your mind is a priority. That way, everyone can be happy together. The meaning of 'together' is deeply carved into the heart, and the heart is united. The place of the Boryeong Mud Festival that is enjoyable without anyone being alienated is so beautiful.
Unfortunately, the 2017 Boryeong Mud Festival ended on July 31st. However, Sky Bike is available all year round, and the open sea is available during the opening of the beach.
Sky bike in harmony with the sea landscape
Stairs, not obstacles, with human service at all times-Sky Bike
If you don't want to immerse yourself in the sea water and experience mud, try sky bike.
Stairs not obstacles due to human service operation
This is a 4-person bike ride along a rail installed on a sandy beach and runs 2.3 km over the sea.
Safe boarding with staff assistance
Unfortunately, there is no wheelchair ramp from the ticket office to the platform.
Skybike boarding completed
However, there are no inconveniences because the staff are always on standby to help the disabled with wheelchair use, and human services are provided. It is also the staff's responsibility to help the wheelchair sit in the bike.
Skybike for the disabled
There is no difficulty in accessing the stairs of the doorway by operating the staff to guide you on boarding the Sky Bike.
The bike with the guardian begins to move forward little by little. From the crowded beaches to the horizon far away from the crowded people, you can see the beautiful scenery of the ocean in front of Daecheon at a glance. Although it is sunny, the wind blows at the speed of running. If it's still hot, you can unfold the rainbow-colored umbrellas, each plugged into the back of the front seat. It would be fun if it were flat. There are 203 meters and 173 meters downhill, respectively, on the way to the loop point and on the way back from the loop point to the platform. The maximum speed of the downhill section is 20 km / h. Because of the high tide time, the thrill of enjoying on the sea filled with water is dizzy. Of course, if there is a downhill, there is also an uphill. Fortunately, the uphill course is equipped with an automatic driving system on the rail, so you don't have to pedal hard.
Zipline running alongside Skybike
In addition to running while admiring the beautiful scenery of the sea, it is another fun to gauge the thrill that people riding on the zip line right next to, or to share their greetings with oncoming bikers.
The scenery of Daecheon Beach between Haesong

item.title: Three Boryeong mini beaches, Yongdu, Doksan, and Jangan - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
Nampo Seawall Yongdu Beach at the southern end

Three Boryeong mini beaches, Yongdu, Doksan, and Jangan

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

Boryeong city in Chungnam has tourist attractions such as Oseo Mountain and Boryeong Lake in the inland, Daecheon Beach and Muchangpo Beach on the coast. The Daecheon Beach is the site of the Boryeong Mud Festival, and the Muchangpo Beach is famous for opening the sea of mystery. That's why summer vacationers visit a lot. If you are planning a summer resort on the beach of Boryeong, look back at Yongdu, Doksan, and Jangan. Accommodations, restaurants, public transportation, toilets, and showers are more inconvenient than Daecheon or Muchangpo, but are said to be a suitable summer resort for those who want a relatively less crowded beach.

Daecheon Beach, which is considered as the first view in the 8th Boryeong view, is famous for its white sand beach. It is 3.5km north-south and about 100m wide. Centered on the Mud Square (formerly known as the Women's Square), it is divided into a fountain square in the north and a citizen tower square in the south. In the summer season, cruise ships sail from Mud Square to an island called Davodo, an uninhabited island floating 4km ahead. A gravel beach is formed in Davo Island. Between the Civic Tower Square and Solbat Beach Campground, there was a Boryeong Mud Experience Center. The first floor is the Mud Experience Center, and the second floor is the Mud Promotion Hall. At the fountain square, the music fountain with beautiful lighting at night will entertain visitors.
Daecheon Beach stained with sunset
It is a fault that Daecheon Beach, which has all good conditions, is one of the three major beaches on the west coast. In order to avoid the hustle and bustle, you need to cross the Nampo Seawall (about 3.7km in length) starting at the southern end of the Daecheon Beach entrance. Construction of the seawall began in 1985 and was completed in 1997. The Jukdo tourist spot in the middle of the seawall (8th out of the 8th Boryeong) is also worth a visit. There is a port where fishing boats and fishing boats are portrayed, and sashimi restaurants serving tourists are a successful island.
Jukdopogu and Nampo seawall
The Yongdu Beach hidden at the southern end of the Nampo Embankment was a secluded place where the citizens of Boryeong visited without a rumor when Daecheon Beach occupied tourists. But now it has become an old saying. Although the beach is about 1km long, it boasts a cozy taste instead. In particular, Songlim is lush behind the beach, and is loved as a camping ground for vacationers. Although the pine trees are not thick, the population is so large that the sky cannot be seen.
Solbat Campground at Yongdu Beach
Behind the pine forest in the center of Yongdu Beach, there is a lodging facility called Dongbaekgwan (041-933-4005), built in red brick. The general welfare center operated by Boryeong-si was opened in 1996, and the facility was somewhat old. It has a 200-seat restaurant and meeting room, and there are 33 rooms on the first floor, including three (group rooms), two on the second floor, and three on the third floor. Dongbaekgwan operates a shower and a camping site until August for those who visit Yongdu Beach. The usage fee for a shower is 1,100 won for adults and 550 won for children, and a camping tent is cheap for 3,300 won per day for a tent for 4 people (4 pyeong).
Wait here, let's go to know the origin of Nampo. It is estimated as the Goryeo Dynasty. Here, there were frequent appearances of Japanese dwarf on the beach. Then an old man discovered a secret. The fact that those boring dwarves love fugu! A blowfish that eats the petals of an indigo plant is fatal to a person. The people planted a lot of sesame seeds on the beach in front of them to get rid of the Japanese dwarf. After that, I started to write the letter “nam” in the place name. The shrine of the folks who tried to subdue the Japanese pufferfish was highlighted.
Camellia

After exiting Yongdu Beach, take the prefectural road 607 to the south, and you will see Muchangpo Beach, Doksan Beach, and Jangan Beach. It is Seocheon-gun, famous for ramie, when crossing the busan seawall at the entrance of Jangan Beach.
I visit the beach in Chungnam, but no matter how busy I am, I cannot miss the Muchangpo Beach. Muchangpo Beach, the second of the 8 Boryeong sights, was opened in 1928. The sandy beach is 1.5km long and 50m wide. It is the second most popular beach in Boryeong after Daecheon. Here, there is a 1.5km sea route to Seokdae Island in front of the beach around the moon and eve of the moon every month. The phenomenon of seawater splitting itself is mysterious and you can catch crabs, seashells, sea cucumbers, sea shells, and octopus along the exposed sea path, so tourists will never stop. National Maritime Research Institute website ( www.khoa.go.kr ), You can check the sea cracking forecast.

Muchangpo Beach

Doksan Beach is located to the south of Muchangpo Beach. It is also called Holmö Beach. It is impressive that there is a small hill in the middle of the beach that is mistaken for an island. On the beach, which is only about 10 m wide, you can see Jangan Beach and Busa Beach in the south and Doksan Beach in the north. It's a good place for a greedy traveler to be able to hold two beaches in the arms without a few steps.

Secluded Doksan Beach
At the northern end of Doksan Beach, a cape called “Chicken Rice Stalk” protrudes from the Muchangpo Beach and serves as a boundary line. The beach looks somewhat shorter than Muchangpo. A lot of family members visit and catch shellfish when it is time to drain. Families who have prepared ice boxes, ranch packs, salt, and onion nets are striking. Local residents are urged to catch properly because it is an act that destroys the environment.
If you need to go straight to Doksan Beach without visiting any other place, you should go out to Muchangpo IC instead of Daecheon IC. There are quite a few accommodations and restaurants on this beach.
A child on a clamshell

Jangan Beach, located at the southernmost point of Boryeong, is a beach hidden at the beginning of the quasi-dwelling. On a weekday morning, a group of seagulls is the owner of a rare sandy beach. This place is also rumored to be a clam catcher. However, it is more important than a well-behaved beach. The north beach of Jangan Beach is the 'Sohwangsa-gu' ecological learning site. There is a signboard at the entrance to the beach, so take a look. Along the ecological trail made of wooden decks, there are a cluster of seaweed flowers and a corresponding village, and if you walk further, you can see a community of bands, a village of Gojirisacho, and a community of seaweed wind. Sohwang Wetland, Sohwang Sand Dune, and Songlim Colony with Haesong are important resources for Jangan Beach.

Jangan Beach
The coastal sand dunes are one of the coastal sedimentary terrains along with tidal flats, sabins (sand coasts), and wetlands. Endangered wildlife such as yellow-billed egrets, black-headed pheasants, leopard lizards, falcons, and 삵 are observed here in the coastal sand dunes.
Jangan Beach Coastal Sand Dunes
If you want to meet some inland destinations after enjoying water on the beach, you can also visit the Coal Museum, Seongjusaji Temple, and Seongjusan Natural Recreation Forest. Boryeong City is a famous coal producing area as well as Jeongseon or Taebaek in Gangwon Province, and the Coal Museum was built. You can see everything about coal through the process of coal generation, the use of coal, and mining village models. If you take the elevator effect that operates for 60 seconds, you will experience the experience of going down to the tunnel below 400m underground.
Seongjusaji

If you go to Seongjusaji (Historic Site No. 307) near Seongjusan Natural Recreation Forest, you will fall in love with the exploration of our site. It was founded in the name of Ohabsa during the Baekje King. During the reign of the Unified Shilla Era, the name of the Sung Dynasty changed to Seongju during the reign of the Tang Dynasty Confucian School. At the temple site, there are still the Sunghyesaji Nanghyehwa Pagoda Monument (National Treasure No. 8), the five-storied stone pagoda, the central three-story stone pagoda, and the east and west three-storied stone pagoda.
Seongjusan Natural Recreation Forest (041-934-7133,

seongjusan.brcn.go.kr )

Has a water playground, a forest bath, a lawn square, a fitness center, and a campsite. The Forest Culture Recreation Center, which has 8 rooms, such as a revenge room, and 9 forest houses, such as the Squirrel Building, are used as accommodations. At the Recreation Forest Observatory, the summits of Seongju and Mansu are greeted.

item.title: Treasures from the West Sea's arms ‘Key shell of Boryeong Ocheon Port’ - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
A delicious clamshell

Treasures from the West Sea's arms ‘Key shell of Boryeong Ocheon Port’

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

There is a saying that all roads in the northern Boryeong area connect with Ocheon. This is because the port of Ocheon served as the main port and military port of Boryeong in the Baekje period. Since then, Ocheon Port has become a small fishing port, but recently it has been regaining its old glory due to the clamshell. Ocheon Port occupies about 60% of the country's production, and gourmets from all over the country gather at the port. Azalea blooming is the key season in April.

At a depth of 40m, a murmur can dig
The Chinese characters for ‘오천’ are ‘Zara O (鰲)’ and ‘My Heaven’. The name is given because the terrain of Cheonsu Bay including Ocheon is like Zara. Since the mountain on both sides of the sea acts as a breakwater, there is no damage even in severe storms, and the depth of the water is a port of bliss, which is not at all uncomfortable for the passage of ships due to the tide.
It is said to be a port, but it is small. There is no change in facilities for tourists. There is a restaurant along the beach, and you can buy your favorite seafood at the restaurant. Nevertheless, the reason to visit Ocheon Port in the spring is because it is the country's largest mountain clam.
The key clam is embedded vertically in deep sandy soil at a depth of 20-50m. It is not caught by fishing, nor is it rolled up by a net. Only people directly go into the sea and deliver them one by one. It's up to the Muzzle to pick up the keyshell. The name, unfamiliar, is the diver's short name. Refers to a person who enters seawater to catch meat or harvest seafood.
The Mughly goes out to the sea in time to work. Hold the key shell while wandering in the sea for 3 hours in short and 6 hours in long. Full days are available for work. When it's saree, the water is so strong that I can't work, but only when I work a little.
Ocheon Port scenery
It is common for the Mook of Ocheon Port to go over 40m deep in search of a key shell. It is difficult and dangerous, but it is inevitable because the key shell is the money that supports life. Equipment is all water glasses and a rake. Even though he says he is wearing a wet suit, the equipment is very simple. This is all the respirators that have air hoses connected to them. It is said that the sturdy helmet used by deep sea divers is better because it does not interfere with the extraction of the key shell.
Tall cockle
When a mercury jumps into the sea, air bubbles rise up one by one over a calm surface. In the open sea, this is all about the traces of Mughly. All the sailors in the boat can do is wait for his signal, then lower the fishing net, and check whether the air is getting well through the air hose or if the hose is not twisted.
Keyhole landscape
Until the end of the work, the head must struggle for two or three hours, walking alone in the cold and dark waters. Actually, the working time is not really decided for Mughly. When the specified amount is filled, the work is finished. If you go to the wrong place, you have to struggle with pain. The height of the shellfish that can be collected per day is limited to 3,000 US dollars. To protect fish resources. So, in order to get a good price, you need to dig a 25 ~ 28cm tall clam that grew 8 ~ 9 years. From April to May when clear water comes in, the view in the sea is bright, making it a good season to work. At this time, it is the wish of the murky to increase the income by working a lot.
A worm that goes into the sea with a simple outfit
The sea off the front of Ocheon Port is a paddy field and a field of Meguri's love. Just as a farmer waits for a year to farm, Meguri searches carefully for treasures in the sea. Thanks to this, gourmets enjoy the joy of being presented with natural shellfish from clean waters.
Keyhole landscape
The chewy but soft texture is the best
The key clam was named because the shape of the clam was similar to the key that smashed the sword of grain. It was collected from the South Sea, such as Jangheung, Jeollanam-do, and exported to Japan, but in the 1970s, it became known as a major production area for the key seashells as it became known that a lot of shellfishes lived near the Ocheon Port in the West Sea.
Key shelling down to the port
In the past, all shellfish was exported to Japan, so it was hard to taste. In the 1990s, it appeared in the market and sold in restaurants, making it an easy food to eat. Even now, about 30% of production is exported to Japan.
Ships that came out to catch the clam at dawn
There is a light yogurt-like rout in the thick, tall key shell. Because the clams are big, they eat fat, not like any other clams.
Ocheon Port Keyshell
Even a loser is much bigger than a small clam. The loser is sweet and tender. The chewy taste is also excellent. The circuit is also eaten, but it is even more delicious when paired with beef sirloin and eaten over a grill. For children, it is good to bake it in butter.
Ocheon Port Keyshell
Key shellfish is a low-calorie food and contains a lot of minerals and vitamins that benefit the body. Paeju is a treasure trove of zinc containing 12.8 mg per 100 g of zinc. Protein also contained 18.2 g per 100 g and taurine 994 mg per 100 g. It is good for postpartum cooking or fatigue recovery of pregnant women because it has a blood clotting effect, and is also effective in protecting the liver that has been abused by alcohol.
Key shells are trimmed separately
Galmaemot Holy Land, which holds the sad history of Catholic persecution
In the vicinity of Ocheon Port is the Galmaemot Holy Land, which holds the sad history of Catholic persecution. This is the place where five people, including Bishop Davllu, Father Ometre, and Father Wien, were arrested during the persecution on March 30, 1866. At this time, the remains of three martyred priests are placed in the basement of the Myeongdong Cathedral.
There is a reason that this distant beach became the scene of Catholic persecution. In June of the 12th year of the Joseon Dynasty (1846), three French warships anchored at the remotest island of Boryeong. Then, in the persecution of Gihae (1839), he left a letter in the box asking for responsibility for the murder of three French missionaries, including Enver, Imitation, and Father Charles. The case was regarded as an invasion of the territorial waters of Joseon by the court. At that time, the execution of Father Kim Dae-geon, who was in prison, was accelerated, and on March 30, 1866, in the sense that Heungseon-daewon troops threw a Western orangka, five French swimmers, including Bishop Davllu, took a swimming near the island of the French invasion. The bride was dragged and executed. The position of the martyrdom is now standing where the priests were executed.

item.title: Autumn tour of Boryeong Oseosan where silver silver grass, golden field, and sunset of the West Sea blend - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
Sunset from Oseo Mountain

Autumn tour of Boryeong Oseosan where silver silver grass, golden field, and sunset of the West Sea blend

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

Autumn has come silently, but the ripe autumn leaves still have to wait. As I wait for the autumn leaves, I go to a place where I'm impatient or the autumn breeze is overwhelming. It is a silver grass colony of Oseo Mountain in Boryeong, Chungnam. The sunset over the silver grass, the golden field and the glow of the west coast are bonuses. I loaded my body on a train on the Janghang Line and walked into the autumn.
Take a train on the Janghang Line and plow in the silver wave!
At this time when the news of the autumn leaves is heard, the silver grass that gleams with silver also attracts travelers. Oseosan, which spans Boryeong, Hongseong, and Cheongyang, Chungcheongnam-do, has a spectacular view of silver grass since early October. It is considered as one of the top five silver grass spots in the nation, along with Myeongseongsan Mountain in Pocheon-si, Gyeonggi-do, Mindongsan Mountain in Jeongseon-gun in Gangwon, Cheongwansan Mountain in Jangheung-gun, Jeollanam-do, and Sajapyeong Saegil-gil in Ulju-gun, Ulsan. One of the eight sights of Boryeong is the silver grass that stretched gently on the ridge of Oseo Mountain. It has a view of Daecheon Beach, Muchangpo and Oeyeon Islands, so you can see half the unexplored sights of Boryeong at about 8 moments on the ridge.
The golden grass of Oseosan at sunset
Oseosan is a rarely high mountain (790m above sea level) on the west coast where most of the plains are located. It is for this reason that the scenery under the feet is toxic. Standing at the summit, the sea spreads to the west and the fields of Hongseong and Cheongyang to the east.
A silver grass colony follows the 2km ridge
If you want to feel the excitement of the autumn trip, we recommend you take the slow-moving Mugunghwa Lake to the nearest station in Oseosan.
Quiet and compact cleaning station
A small bench was placed in the small waiting room, but Lee Rae-tuk also had the longest history on the Janghang line. Janghang Station, which has remained on the Janghang Line for many years, has been designated as a Korean cultural heritage.
Quiet and compact cleaning station
Standing on the platform, the gentle ridge of Oseo Mountain can be seen at a glance. As the name of 'blue place', the scenery over the railroad tracks is all over the forest and the sky. It is also a good idea to stop for a moment at the simple station in the autumn sun and feel the relaxed mood. Taxi waiting for hikers is always waiting in front of the cleaning station. It takes 10-15 minutes to reach Seongyeon Parking Lot, the head of Oseosan Mountain or Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest.
Oseosan ridge over the railroad
A forest road full of autumn mood
The heads to Oseosan silver grass colony are the counseling parking lot in Damsan-ri, Gwangcheon-eup, Hongseong-gun, the Seongyeon parking lot in Seongyeon-ri, Jangyeon-myeon, Boryeong-si, and the Oseosan natural recreation forest in Janghyeon-ri, Cheongnyeon. The shortest route to the summit of Oseosan is the Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest Course. It is good to stay overnight in a recreational forest and go up and down.
Forest experience road full of chestnuts
It is the fastest way to go straight from the management office to Woljeongsa Temple, but the path leading to Woljeongsa Temple from the forest experience route on the left side of the Forest Culture Recreation Center is even more impressive. It takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes from the forest experience route to the top of Oseo Mountain. As it is a short course, the slope is quite steep, so it is better to climb with a spare time.
Many acorns also make acorns common
The forest experience is a gentle dirt road. The hornbeam tree, the dead tree, the willow tree, and the oak tree form a dense forest to cover the sky. The green color is still widespread, but chestnuts and fallen leaves accumulate to give off the autumn mood. After passing the trail for about 20 minutes, we reach Woljeongsa Temple when the sound of the wooden voice approaches. Gujeolcho bloomed all over the small hermitage.
Autumn messenger, Gujeolcho
I hung my neck at Woljeongsa Temple and went on my way again. The pine forest lined up on both sides boasts a quiet atmosphere. Occasionally, the red-colored maple trees mark the path of autumn. When the pine forest road ends and the three-way intersection comes out, the uphill road begins in earnest. By the time you climb your steep path for 15 minutes, you can see a sign that you have 700m to the summit.
When you pass the iron staircase, a panoramic view appears.
As you climb the last gate, the iron staircase, your view finally expands. On the opposite side, the golden fields are unfolding under the stem of Seongju and the whole area of Hwaam-ri, Cheongyang-gun can be seen at a glance. Abundance of wind penetrates the whole body like the autumn field. Even the fluttering silver grass begins to catch its eye, but it is still tasteful.
Autumn field in autumn
end
When you climb the ridge and see the communication tower, the summit of Oseosan is in front of you. From here, the ridge-filled ridgeline extends for about 2 km. The silver grass that grew as tall as both sides of the trail breaks the road like an escort, and the silver grass colony waving constantly in the breeze of the sea creates a spectacular view. The silver grass, which begins to bloom from the beginning of October, peaks in mid-October by blooming whiter and more abundant flowers.
Silver grass that covered the ridge
The famous sight of Oseo Mountain is not less than that, and at this time, it is a sunset with a golden sunset. The silver grass, which shimmered in silver during the day, is golden in the evening. It is a scenery that "you can get away from all kinds of wrestling and taste the ecstasy" like the words engraved on the headstone of the summit. However, in the fall, the sun is short, so it is better to go down as quickly as possible.
Hiker looking at sunset
The river line flowing from Boryeong dyke to the West Sea can be seen at a glance over the field. On fine days, Daecheon Beach, Muchangpo Beach, and floating islands spread far and wide. The crow often flies in the distant landscape, but the name Oseosan originated from the many crows since ancient times. There is a theory that when you look at Oeyeon Island, a long distance from the land, you can see the mountain black and named it Oseo Mountain.
Landscape of Oseosan at sunset with silver grass, sea and plains
If you want a more dramatic scenery, I recommend going along the ridge about 1km from the top to Oseojeong. There is a wide viewing deck, so you can relax.
Landscape of Oseosan at sunset with silver grass, sea and plains
If you return to the Natural Recreation Forest, you can take the Hassan-gil toward Gongdeok Pass near the top. This is the road leading to the parking lot of the natural recreation forest. Compared to Woljeongsa Temple, the slope is gentle and you can go down comfortably.
Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest
If you can afford it, you can stay in Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest for a day. It is located in a dense forest along the Myeongdae Valley, so you can stay quietly. The bamboo forest path and forest experience path behind the forest training center are good for a morning walk.
Bamboo forest in Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest

item.title: Drive trip while looking at Anmyeondo - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
bow

Drive trip while looking at Anmyeondo

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

The most common way to get to Taemyeon's Anmyeondo is to cross the Seosan AB district shelter from Hongseong IC of the West Coast Expressway. If you follow the coastal road south of Gongnipo-gu before Seosan AB Earthquake began, the Namdang Port and Cheonbuk Guldan are well known for their fresh and abundant seafood, as well as Hongseong's Sokdong Observatory, Hongseong Embankment Observatory, and Chungcheongsu Swimming Coastal Observatory. Meet the observation deck that contains scenery. Also waiting for meaningful landmarks, such as Chungcheong-Soo-Sungseong, which was called Ocheon-Sung, the tomb of Dr. Lee Ji-Ham, the protagonist of 《Tojeong Secrets》, and Madam Shrine of Baekje. Enjoy a drive tour along the coasts of Hongseong and Boryeong, overlooking Anmyeondo Island.
Coastal road running along Anmyeondo Island, from Gongnipogu to Namdang Port
Most of the tourists who enter the Anmyeondo with the excitement of the summer trip come out of the Honghae IC of the West Coast Expressway and cross the Seosan AB district. But just before crossing the seawall, let's run from Hari Intersection towards the coastal road. It doesn't lead to a single road, but most can run along the sea from Hongseong to Boryeong. It is a road running to the left with only Cheonsu and looking at Anmyeondo, which is like a long and long belt.
If you get off at the Hari Intersection just before crossing the Seosan AB District Embankment, Imhae Tourist Road begins. Imhae Tourist Road is a 16km road from Bugi-ri, Galsan-myeon to Mokhyeon-ri, Eunhae. Among them, 4.1 km from Gongni to Eosari in Seomyeon-myeon is called the West Coast Imhae Tourist Road. It is a beautiful coastal road that extends across the bay.
Scenery at low tide on Mulli Beach
Gongnipogu, a secluded fishing village at the start of the West Coast Imhae Tourist Road, welcomes you first. The wide open mudflat is peaceful just by looking at it. The fishermen who live in the open tideland are also seen. In Gongnipo-gu, there is 'Cheonsu Bay Hanul Floor' with sculptures for fishing on the roof. If you make a reservation here, you can enjoy natural fishing and cage fishing in the marine fishing park.
View from Sokdong Observatory
It is the Sokdong Observatory with the best view of the coastal road after passing Gongnipogu. It is a beautiful view point of Cheonsu Bay and Anmyeondo Island. Originally there was only a two-story observatory on the coast, but another observatory was installed on the small island, the island, in front of the observatory. Follow the deck path from Sokdong Observatory to Moseom and climb to the top of Moseom. It is called a “Titanic Observation Deck” because it is shaped like a small boat. The tideland of Cheonsuman Bay, where seawater has escaped, is a vast land. Ganwolam can be seen in the distance, and the long Anmyeondo along Cheonsuman Bay divides the sea and the sky. In Sokdong Tidal Flat Village, a tidal flat experience is also possible when the tide is right.
A place called the Titanic Observation Deck
On the coastal road, early cosmos adds to the excitement of a peer-driven trip. The West Coast Imhae Tourist Road passes at Sokdong Observatory and ends at Eosa Intersection. However, the drive tour continues along the National Highway No. 40 through the Namdang Port and Hongseong Dynasty.
Namdang Port Breakwater
Between the seawall and the seawall, from Hongseong seawall to Boryeong seawall
From the Eosa Intersection, take National Route 40 for about 2.5km and it is Namdang Port, famous for Daeha and the new clam. The seasonal seafood is also taking a break from tempo Han Gatjin July and August. Namdang Port, where the bustle has disappeared, is a quiet port that only passes quietly. If it's King Lee, go to the breakwater with a lighthouse that warmly surrounds Namdang Port. It is a breakwater that is large enough to have a two-lane road. When you get near the lighthouse, you can see the panoramic view of Namdang Port. Outside the breakwater, you can still see the long-lasting face and the close-up Jukdo. Jukdo Island floating in the middle of Cheonsu Bay and the orange roofs visible across the coast of Jukdo Island do not leave their eyes for a while.
Hongseong Embankment Observatory
If you pass Namdang Port, you will be off the coast, but it is also the sea for a while. This time, a unique structure emerges. It is a Hongseong Embankment built on the border between Hongseong and Boryeong. On the way from Hongseong to Boryeong, there are two seawalls, which are the Hongseong Fortress that connects Seomyeon-myeon, Hongseong-gun, and Cheonbuk-myeon, Boryeong-si, and Boryeong, which connects Cheonbuk-myeon, Boryeong-si and Ocheon-myeon, Boryeong-si.
Panoramic view of Hongseong Embankment. The other side is Cheonbukgul Complex
When you climb the mountain at the entrance of the Hongseong Embankment, the completion tower of the Hongseong · Boryeong Embankment stands. At the end of the mountain is an observation deck overlooking the Hongseong Embankment. It overlooks the Cheonbuk Guldan Complex, famous for its long straight seawall and oysters. Jukdo Island, which was seen horizontally from the Namdang Port, is more three-dimensional when viewed from the observation deck. On the back side of Jukdo Island, Anmyeondo surrounded like a folding screen.
Completed tower of Hongseong · Boryeong Seawall
Chungcheong swimming coastal observatory and Chungcheong swimming
As soon as you cross the Boryeong Seawall and turn right, there is a special attraction. It is the observatory of Chungcheong-Suyeong coastal landscape built on the hillside. ‘Palsaek Boryeong Essay’ refers to eight themes of 《Gwanchon Essay》 by Boryeong Born novelist Lee Mun-gu.
Chungcheong Swim Coastal Observatory from the Boryeong Dynasty
Crossing the road from the parking lot leads to the observatory. It is about 500m to the observatory, and you can climb a steep mountain path for about 20 minutes.
Chungcheong Swim Coast Observation Deck
There are two observation decks. The lower part is an overhanging observatory that protrudes out into the air, and the upper part is another viewing point that can be overlooked from a higher point. Below, the Boryeong Embankment, Chungcheongsuseongseong, Ocheon Port, and Anmyeondo Island and the West Sea are visible. From the observation deck, you can see the ridge of Oseo Mountain from the northeast.
Ocheon Port and Chungcheong Swimming
Bingdo inside the toxic Boryeong Embankment catches the eye. This is the place where Domi and Ms. Domi, who were in the family due to the tyranny of King Gaero of Baekje, left for Goguryeo by boat. There is a dormitory shrine at the foot of the mountain on the northeast side of the observation deck.
A stunning 2nd floor observatory at the Chungcheong swimming coastal observatory
From the observatory parking lot to the port of Ocheon, it is a long time. There remains a historic site No. 501 Chungcheong-Sungseong, originally called Ocheonseong in Ocheon Port. Only the west gate of the castle has a rainbow-shaped trace of Hongyemun, where you can take a look around Chungcheong-Sungseong. The scenery of the Ocheon Port and the Boryeong Seawall from here is quite beautiful.
Hongyemun, the entrance to Chungcheong Suyeongseong
At the entrance to Ocheonseong, there is 'Oyangson Kalguksu', which is well-known as Bajirak Kalguksu and Bibimbuksu. The sun-dried lotus root is made with noodle, which is then ripened, and the thick, chewy noodles are good for bibimbap or clam noodles. In addition to spicy noodles and bibimbap noodles, soybean noodles are also served in summer. It is also unique to have a menu that allows you to taste two noodles together, like Jjajangmyeon and Jjambyeon, which you can taste in half.
Boryeong View from Chungcheong-Sooseong
If you run behind Ocheon Port, you will see Galmaemot Holy Land after a while. If you pass here, the road will be far from the sea, and after a long run through the Tomb of Mr. Lee Ji-ham, you will enter the city of Boryeong.
Biyang and Noodles from Oyang Son Kalguksu

item.title: Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village - Boryeong, South Korea
item.description:
Ginkgo biloba shedding leaves already

Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village

Boryeong, South Korea

Autumn begins in heaven and ends on earth. Looking at the clear sky without a cloud, we realize that autumn has come. Autumn is in full swing as you look at the colorful leaves colored in the air. And looking at the carpeted land where falling rain drops fall, we feel that autumn is about to leave. Choosing to enjoy autumn until the last moment when it runs from the air to the ground is Cheongna Bank Village in Boryeong-si, Chungnam.
The largest ginkgo colony in Korea
Enters Cheongna Bank Village, located at the foot of Oseo Mountain, Cheong Ramyeon, Boryeong-si. Even in early November, autumn is in full swing. Some ginkgo trees have begun to drop ginkgo biloba due to their temper, but there are still many ginkgo trees that are slowly green.
Ginkgo leaves seem to be a week slower than any other year because of heat and drought, the locals say. This year, you will be able to enjoy the yellow waves of Cheongna Bank Village until a little later.
Ginkgo tree still green
Cheongna Bank Village looks like the largest ginkgo grove in Korea. Ginkgo trees come in from the village entrance to the snow. It is not an exaggeration to say that over 3,000 ginkgo trees are growing in the village.
Cheongna Ginkgo Village
How did Ginkgo live here? The legend of the village is told. Since ancient times, Janghyeon Village (Cheongna Bank Village) has been called Oseosan because there are many crows. A yellow pit lived by a small pond under the mountain. The worm prayed for ease every day for a thousand years. On the day of the millennium, the goblin finally became Hwang Ryong and ascended with Yeouiju. Crows around Oseo-san watched this scene. Later, the crows looked for food, found a yellow bank, and thought that it was Yeoui-ju, which Hwang was biting. That is why Ginkgo trees are now inhabited in Janghyeon village.
Ginkgo trees can be found anywhere in town
Apart from the legend, there are also entities that reveal the origin of Cheongna Bank Village. It is a 500-year-old Sugo tree in front of the nerve house (Chungcheongnam-do Cultural Heritage No. 291). The ginkgo trees of Cheongna Bank Village are almost dark trees. After a round of town, the smell from the tip of the shoe proves this. The 500-year-old ginkgo biloba has played a role in bringing the fruit of many dark trees in the Cheongna ginkgo village.
Walking through the village, you can see the drying up of the banks.
Ginkgo trees that are aesthetically cultivated in the city have many trees that do not bear fruit, but in rural areas, they grow many trees that bear fruit because their purpose is for living. At one time, the villagers called ginkgo trees as 'college trees'. When the bank quotes were good, a few trees helped me get my college tuition.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
Although the value of the bank is not so great now, it is still a good source of income for the residents of Cheongna Bank Village. It is known that the amount of banks held in Cheongna Bank Village alone is over 100 tons. The nickname of 'Bank town with a bank' is not just funny.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
A round of bank town of 'Trial History'
You don't have to worry about where to look around the Cheongna Bank Village. It's enough to walk along the road around town.
Bank village round road sign
Ginkgo trees stand along the fields, along the streams and along the earthen houses. There is no artificial feeling. It's as natural as it is. That is because the Cheongna Bank Village is not a place for planting and decorating Ginkgo trees to show people. As the villagers planted and grown a lot of ginkgo trees, they became known for the autumn leaves and tourists began to visit.
Closed Janghyeon Elementary School transformed into a green farming experience
Because it is not an artificially created tourist spot, there is no large parking lot. The park is set up at the old Janghyeon Elementary School or Jeongchon Organic Farm, which is used as a green farming experience center in the bank village. Rural scenery of the village and the ginkgo trees scattered here and there complete the scenery in autumn.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
The points of the bank villages are Sinseop House and Jeongchon Organic Farm. Among them, Sinseop house is the best rice in the bank village. The house is a hanok, the late Joseon Dynasty. Around the old house are ginkgo trees over 100 years old. Dignity can be felt in the landscape of old-fashioned houses and trees. At first glance, it's too bad to see it. It is fun to look thirsty outside. When thirsty for the intact landscape is at its peak, spraying the yard takes its foot. It's as if you're walking into a single elegant painting. The scenery of thirsty staring outside the fence and the view from the courtyard are attractive.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
Jeongchon Organic Farm provides another flavor. The center is equipped with a small ecological park, a hanok pension and a rural healing cafe.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard Surrounded by Beautiful Ginkgo Trees
The yard, surrounded by beautiful ginkgo trees, is perfect to feel the fall. Ginkgo leaves full of trees flutter in the wind and fall one by one.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard provides a comfortable resting place in autumn
During the autumn, when the ginkgo trees are yellow, there is a snack market at the café and a small produce market in the yard.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
Banks, sweet potatoes, and chestnuts harvested from Jeongchon Organic Farm are often delicious jeonjuburi in autumn.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
The annual Cheongna Bank Village Festival is held from late October to early November. During the festival, there are various experience programs centered on the former Janghyeon Elementary School. This year's festival took place on October 29 and 30. The festival is over, but don't be afraid. The peak of autumn leaves has not passed since this year's bank leaves were late. Rather, the village's advice is that from the first weekend in November to the second week of the week, you can savor the yellow waves of the Cheongna bank village. It would be great to visit Cheongna Bank Village during the best time to see autumn leaves, but it may be a little early or a little late. The lush peaks of the beautiful ginkgo trees are beautiful, but the mysterious moment of the transition from fresh green to yellow is also fascinating.
A rustic country village becomes special with ginkgo in autumn

item.title: Boryeong, South Korea - A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok
item.description:
You can enjoy the sea and hanok scenery at the Sanghwa Garden.

A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok

Boryeong, South Korea

Hanok entered the island. The tree that guarded the island wrapped up the old house after it was declared. Man reached out and made his way and made a pond. The sea from the island was harmonious and named it Sanghwawon. It is the story of a garden on Jukdo. Because of the beautiful scenery, rumors spread across the island. If you're eager to avoid the heat and quiet alone, head to Boryeong-si Jukhwa Garden.
The whole island becomes a garden
It takes about 10 minutes to Jukdo after getting off at Daecheon Station on Janghang Line. The island, originally floating on the West Sea, was connected with land by roads for reclamation. Although once in danger of development, the island owner's insistence on maintaining the nature of Jukdo could be preserved.
The owner pondered a meaningful way to protect the island. It was decided to create a garden named Sanghwawon with the meaning of worshiping harmony. Jukdo was determined not to hurt the nature. What did you think about bringing hanok to the island? The encounter between the two, which felt only heterogeneous, was exquisite when I think about it today. Visitors were happy to meet an unexpected Hanok on the island. It was a hanok that prolonged life in front of the crisis.
Lee Dae Cheong House
Wherever in the Sangwon Garden, the sea seems to be in your hands. Dense forests on the road and shoulders are enough to hide. If the crowded destination is burdensome, the Sangwon House is a wonderful hideaway that will make my whereabouts brief.
Hong's house door
Walk the path of the Sangwon Garden
It takes about an hour and a half to roam the whole house. Need to hurry up to the island? Let's set aside the haste. As you enter the Sanghwawon, you will see a handsome Hanok in front of you. It is Uigo Hall. It is a hanok that was built to be used as sperm in Hwaseong Gwana, Gyeonggi-do. It is assumed that it was built during the late Goryeo or early Joseon Dynasty. Before moving to the upper house, he pitched his tent and wrote it as a coffee shop. If you didn't come here for preservation, the house would have been demolished.
Uigok Hall is currently used as a visitor center. Provide a simple drink and rice cake to the audience. Note that there are no restaurants or stalls inside the Sanghwawon. If you do not have enough water to drink, you can use the bottled water stand on the corridor.
The Sanghwawon viewing starts from the right side with the back of the entrance. Walk along the corridor over 1 km. Give your eyes a green leafy hack before heading to the cloister. There is a humorous wooden boarder who writes about 200 years old, who writes down. A generous shade of trees is a thankful season.
Uigok Hall from the entrance of the Sanghwawon
The signpost written 'entrance to the walk' is the starting point. The white strip on the floor of the corridor serves as a milestone for visitors. Every 50 meters you will see how far you've walked. This saves you the trouble of finding your way and doubles the size of your landscape.
Just follow the white line and you can go round the island
The corridor followed the path of Jukdo Aboriginal people for a long time. There is no bird boring at the height of the island that resembles the contours of the island. The roof is not difficult to walk in bad weather. There are many stairs, so it is inconvenient to go with a stroller or a wheelchair. There is plenty of shelter with chairs and tables in the middle of the street.
If you're thirsty, you can buy it at a bottled water stand.
The curve of the cloister roof that looks a bit off the road from the forest is beautiful. Rising, lowering and bending may look like waves in the West Sea or mimic the roof of a hanok.
Drilled holes in the streets and ceilings without cutting wood
I didn't cut the tree because it hindered the way. To protect the nature by drilling holes in the floor and ceiling. The inconvenience of having to walk away from the trees is rather interesting.
Sangwon Corridor from the Forest
Walk the corridor to rest your mind and body
The beach pond along the corridor is also worth seeing. Cute aquatic plants and fish live. The stone wall around the pond was built directly by human hands. Walking along the corridor, you can see the Hanok Gate in the middle. Thick rust has already sat in the traditional patterned knocker. I hear the squeaking sound I hear when I open the door.
There are 33 beach ponds where aquatic plants and fish live.
The traditional window frame inside the main gate is a popular photo zone. Let's leave the picture against the backdrop of the sea view through the window frame. The window frame pattern is filled with straight lines and curves. You can also open and close it yourself.
